title: Traits
description: Using traits to define shared behavior.

codeExamples.title: Basic Trait
codeExamples.explanation: A trait defines shared behavior. impl Summary for NewsArticle implements the trait for the NewsArticle type. Now NewsArticle can use the summarize() method.

codeExamples.title: Default Implementation
codeExamples.explanation: Trait methods can have default implementations. If a type doesn't implement it explicitly, it uses the default version.

codeExamples.title: Trait Parameters
codeExamples.explanation: The &impl Summary parameter accepts any type that implements the Summary trait. This enables polymorphism.

codeExamples.title: Blockchain: Validatable Trait
codeExamples.explanation: Traits enable polymorphism in blockchain code. Different types (transactions, blocks) can implement the same trait, allowing generic validation functions. This is essential for blockchain architecture.

exercises.title: Trait Implementation
exercises.description: Create a Drawable trait and implement it on a struct!
hints: Use the trait keyword to define a trait
Use the impl TraitName for TypeName syntax to implement
